techs.name: Navigation
techs.quote: 'The winds and the waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.' - Edward Gibbon

techs.name: Architecture
techs.quote: 'Architecture begins where engineering ends.' - Walter Gropius

techs.name: Economics
techs.quote: 'Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Metallurgy
techs.quote: 'There never was a good knife made of bad steel.' - Benjamin Franklin

techs.name: Chemistry
techs.quote: 'Wherever we look, the work of the chemist has raised the level of our civilization and has increased the productive capacity of the nation.' - Calvin Coolidge

techs.name: Archaeology
techs.quote: 'Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.' - George Santayana

techs.name: Scientific Theory
techs.quote: 'Every great advance in science has issued from a new audacity of imagination.' - John Dewey

techs.name: Industrialization
techs.quote: 'Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.' - Emily Greene Balch

techs.name: Rifling
techs.quote: 'It is well that war is so terrible, or we should grow too fond of it.' - Robert E. Lee

techs.name: Military Science
techs.quote: 'Wars may be fought with weapons, but they are won by men. It is the spirit of the men who follow and of the man who leads that gains the victory.' - George S. Patton

techs.name: Fertilizer
techs.quote: 'The nation that destroys its soil destroys itself.' - Franklin Delano Roosevelt

techs.name: Biology
techs.quote: 'If the brain were so simple we could understand it, we would be so simple we couldn't.' - Lyall Watson

techs.name: Electricity
techs.quote: 'Is it a fact - or have I dreamt it - that, by means of electricity, the world of matter has become a great nerve, vibrating thousands of miles in a breathless point of time?' - Nathaniel Hawthorne

techs.name: Steam Power
techs.quote: 'The nations of the West hope that by means of steam communication all the world will become as one family.' - Townsend Harris

techs.name: Dynamite
techs.quote: 'As soon as men decide that all means are permitted to fight an evil, then their good becomes indistinguishable from the evil that they set out to destroy.' - Christopher Dawson

techs.name: Refrigeration
techs.quote: 'And homeless near a thousand homes I stood, and near a thousand tables pined and wanted food.' - William Wordsworth

techs.name: Radio
techs.quote: 'The whole country was tied together by radio. We all experienced the same heroes and comedians and singers. They were giants.' - Woody Allen

techs.name: Replaceable Parts
techs.quote: 'Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs.' - Henry Ford

techs.name: Flight
techs.quote: 'Aeronautics was neither an industry nor a science. It was a miracle.' - Igor Sikorsky

techs.name: Combustion
techs.quote: 'Any man who can drive safely while kissing a pretty girl is simply not giving the kiss the attention it deserves.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Plastics
techs.quote: 'Ben, I want to say one word to you, just one word: plastics.' - Buck Henry and Calder Willingham, The Graduate

techs.name: Electronics
techs.quote: 'There's a basic principle about consumer electronics: it gets more powerful all the time and it gets cheaper all the time.' - Trip Hawkins

techs.name: Ballistics
techs.quote: 'Men, like bullets, go farthest when they are smoothest.' - Jean Paul

techs.name: Pharmaceuticals
techs.quote: 'In nothing do men more nearly approach the gods than in giving health to men.' - Cicero

techs.name: Atomic Theory
techs.quote: 'The unleashed power of the atom has changed everything save our modes of thinking, and we thus drift toward unparalleled catastrophes.' - Albert Einstein

techs.name: Radar
techs.quote: 'Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.' - Jonathan Swift

techs.name: Combined Arms
techs.quote: 'The root of the evil is not the construction of new, more dreadful weapons. It is the spirit of conquest.' - Ludwig von Mises
